title: How To Wear The Humble White Shirt Almost Everywhere
text:
facebook 227 SHARES 
If for some (horrible) reason, your white shirts have been tucked away into oblivion, they need to be pulled out... right now. Not that it had gone anywhere, but the underrated classic has made a power-shoulder-strong appearance in celebrity outfits. In 2017, the humble white shirt ain’t the wardrobe underdog. If anything, it’s the self-sustaining hero of outfits. And, it can be worn to the most unexpected places. We chalked out these celebrity outfits to inspire you to get your white shirt out. To Work 
Anushka Sharma’s asymmetrical shirt, by Kanikal Goyal, is easily a boardroom winner. Pair the style with formal-looking sweatpants, and pull off the best illusion of all times. A photo posted by Lakshmi Lehr (@lakshmilehr) on Dec 19, 2016 at 9:33pm PST To A Night-Out 
Parineeti Chopra is poised to have a good time in her satin white shirt, by Zara. The introduction of a metallic skirt was all the motivation that her not-so-humble shirt needed, to shine. A photo posted by @afashionistasdiaries on Dec 13, 2016 at 6:11am PST To A Fancy Dinner 
Times when the ambience calls for it, wear Sridevi’s combination of a pussy-bow shirt and a flattering pair of culottes, that lead up to a fine pair of heels. A photo posted by filmy SHoT (@filmyshotreal) on Jan 18, 2017 at 10:26pm PST To A Wedding 
Kiara Advani swaps the signature excess for a cool-girl shirt, to pair with her harvest-gold lehenga. Wear this look to your bestie’s wedding, and with mucho gusto. A photo posted by @afashionistasdiaries on Dec 29, 2016 at 1:18am PST To A Glamorous Evening 
Neha Dhupia makes a resounding case for the white shirt with her offbeat Chola outfit. Together, with maximal bow and a rebellious hemline, the shirt acts as the perfect separate with the volumious skirt. A photo posted by Sohaya (@chola_the_label) on Jan 14, 2017 at 11:16am PST To A Retro-Themed Party 
Sonakshi Sinha is one pair of thigh-high boots away from being crowned the best dressed at a 70s themed party. Her white shirt, tucked in an ultra-mini skirt, (both by Zara) should be reserved for groovy nights. A photo posted by Mohit Rai (@mohitrai) on Dec 16, 2016 at 10:20pm PST
